private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D (A is smallest, D is largest among my set).
I act as agent_1 and must only perform moves that involve disks A, B, C, or D.
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the global goal by producing allowed primitive moves for disks A, B, C, D.

private_information: I can move disks E, F, G (E is smallest, G is largest among my set).
I act as agent_2 and must only perform moves that involve disks E, F, or G.
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the global goal by producing allowed primitive moves for disks E, F, G.

private_information: I can move disks H, I, J (H is smallest, J is largest among my set).
I act as agent_3 and must only perform moves that involve disks H, I, or J.
agent_3.goal: Contribute to achieving the global goal by producing allowed primitive moves for disks H, I, J.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' primitive moves into a unified PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver and produce a coherent plan respecting agent restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, right.
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
A larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Disks are ordered by size A smallest through J largest.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C; right peg is empty.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move disks A, B, C, D. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you are permitted to perform.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information} Your goal: {agents->agent_1->goal} Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks A, B, C, or D and that respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not emit PDDL. Keep the moves minimal and valid given the information you have.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can move disks E, F, G. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you are permitted to perform.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information} Your goal: {agents->agent_2->goal} Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks E, F, or G and that respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not emit PDDL. Keep the moves minimal and valid given the information you have.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You can move disks H, I, J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you are permitted to perform.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->agent_3->private_information} Your goal: {agents->agent_3->goal} Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that involve disks H, I, or J and that respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not emit PDDL. Keep the moves minimal and valid given the information you have.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modelling and FastDownward. Integrate the primitive moves provided by the agents into a coherent PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions of the three agents distinct and model agent-specific move capabilities. Ensure the domain encodes Tower of Hanoi rules and the problem encodes the initial and goal configurations.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here are the environment public information: {environment->public_information} Here are the agents' private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information} {agents->agent_2->private_information} {agents->agent_3->private_information} Here are the moves proposed by the agents: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2} {moves_agent_3} Your task is to integrate their primitive moves, resolve any naming or consistency issues, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that FastDownward can consume. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent move actions distinct (for example, move_agent_1, move_agent_2, move_agent_3) and ensure preconditions enforce disk size ordering and per-agent disk move restrictions.
